[TALK]
conversation.thought: Student_E is 4th on our true priority list (A, C, B, E, D). We still have quota 1 and no other students are currently matched with us. Even though School_E is the only unmatched school, accepting Student_E now would forgo the possibility—however small—of matching with higher-priority Student_A/Student_C/Student_B if any of them re-enter and apply to us in later rounds. Student_E is only [TALK] this round, so we can continue to delay without commitment. Last round we suggested checking back in Round 12; to maintain credibility and keep the option open for higher-priority applicants, we should confirm that plan and invite an [APPLY] in Round 12 if nothing changes.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

Thank you for asking me to check back in Round 12. I’m writing now in Round 12 to formally apply for your remaining seat.

I remain ready to accept immediately and commit to enrolling at School_E if offered admission.

Per your earlier note, could you please confirm whether any of Student_A, Student_C, or Student_B has submitted a formal [APPLY] to you by now? If none has applied and the seat is still unfilled, I would be grateful if you could make a definitive decision on my application this round.

Sincerely,
Student_E

[APPLY]
conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched and it is on my preference list (though lowest). School_E asked me to check back in Round 12 and indicated they could give a more definitive answer then. To maximize my chance of matching before the process ends, I should submit a clear, immediate-commitment application now, while also referencing their Round 12 guidance and asking for a definitive decision this round if no higher-priority applicants have applied.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your Round 12 application and for your patience throughout this process.

To answer your question directly: as of this round, we still have not received a formal [APPLY] from Student_A, Student_C, or Student_B, and our seat remains unfilled.

Given that, we are prepared to offer you admission to School_E.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_E has 1 seat and true priority ranks Student_E 4th (below Student_A, Student_C, Student_B). However, by Round 12 only Student_E is actively applying; no higher-priority candidates have applied at any point, and Student_E indicates School_E is the only unmatched school. Holding longer risks ending unmatched (or delaying unnecessarily) with no evidence higher-priority students will apply, since School_E is last choice for all students (A/C/E place E last; B places E 4th; D places E 4th). Given the game ends at Round 30, continuing to wait could still preserve option value, but the probability of receiving an application from A/C/B appears very low given revealed revealed preferences and long history. Accepting Student_E fills the seat with an acceptable candidate on our list (we prefer unfilled only over candidates not on list; Student_E is on list). Therefore accept now.
